content: 1 f-bomb materials list **3 75mm f hook **worsted weight yarn in black red white and one 2 thread of yellow & orange **polyfil **weight of choice rice lentil beans poly-pellets pebbles keep in mind that if you use rice or lentil beans final product should not be washed/immersed in water **small tube sock baby sock works best or mesh/organza bag to contain weighted pellets **tapestry needle **stitch marker **scissors **fabric or hot glue optional skills and abbreviations mc- magic_ring chain - chain 2 single_crochet - single_crochet st - stitch slp st - slip_stitch increase - increase 2 single crochets in each stitch decrease - decrease ** - repeat everything between stars for the entirety of the round flo - front loop only blo - back loop only pattern notes 1 complete pattern in the order it is written ex you will need to complete the wick piece before you complete the top covering piece as the top piece is crocheted and tightened around the wick piece 2 pattern for base is worked in continuous rounds to prevent a seam - a stitch marker is handy for keeping track of your row count wick and the f are both worked in row and the top/covering piece is worked in non-continuous rounds meaning you will join to beginning stitch at the end of each round 3 this pattern uses a magic_ring to start various pieces there are a lot of helpful tutorials on youtube but if you prefer to use the chain method you may single_crochet 3 and do all of round 1 s stitches in the first chain for the wick make sure you enclose the wick after the 4th single_crochet of the round crochet around the wick 4 each round/row has a final stitch count marked with a number inside parentheses example 8 for a round of 8 stitches pattern base piece/bottom using black mc - magic_ring © airavocreations 3 round 1 single_crochet 8 inside magic_ring and use loose end to pull tight and close do not slp st to beginning of row - just simply start your next round in the beginning st to start working in a spiral/continuous rounds 8 round 2 2 single_crochet in each st around 16 round 3 *single_crochet increase single_crochet 1* 24 round 4 *single_crochet increase single_crochet 2* 32 round 5 *single_crochet increase single_crochet 3* 40 rounds 6-16 single_crochet in each st around 40 round 17 decrease round use flo when decreasing to minimize holes *single_crochet decrease in flo single_crochet 3* 32 at this point start stuffing with your weight of choice and fill the rest of the way with polyfil stuffing round 18 *single_crochet decrease in flo single_crochet 2* 24 round 19 *single_crochet decrease in flo single_crochet 1* 16 round 20 single_crochet in flo around 16 rounds 21-23 single_crochet in each st around 16 finish stuffing fasten_off and weave in ends the top will remain open for now move onto the wick next because you will need that piece before the top/cover
